When I shared my issues w/the front desk they immediately asked what they could do to resolve/make my stay more complete and did it. The second week/visit, not so great - Matt was again helpful eventhough he was not checking us in - he rememebered us and made sure we rec'd our items in the room again. This time the issue was the wake-up call came an hour early and when I told them this and asked them to call back at thr right time, the call never came and I missed my meeting start. Second, the restaurant again messed up my check which I learned about at check-out again. Third, when I checked out around 12:15 (which check-out time for all hotels, there was only 1 person at the front desk with a lot of people waiting around to be helped. Lastly, when I checked out and was asked again how my stay was and I relayed the above- the gentleman just kept asking me if I knew who the person (name, man or woman, etc) was that messed up my wake up call (it was 545a I didn't ask for a name) - not the point! And he did nothing to mitigate the inconsistent service. Hotel's facility, room and location are superior. I stay here b/c it is located exactly where my meetings occur so while I'd stay again, I hope the GM of this hotel works on some of this b/c I may be forgiving but the next one not so much,

Reviews.Title: “Tim --, director of front office - rude and disrepectful but portrays himself otherwisef”
Reviews.Author: TimDman
Reviews.Content: Parking fee of $30/night is not reflected on checkout in their website but does come out after payment is processed. Tim --, who is the director of front office told me to educate myself next time. Is this the type of behavior you expect from someone in customer service - highly unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Cold showers for part of stay.”
Reviews.Author: sabres-fan29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a conference. The conference size was roughly 150 to 200 people. The first morning the showers were ice cold. The staff did what they could and told us the truth on what was happening. The next morning the shower worked with lukewarm water for about 5 minutes. The hot water tanks over heated, which was fixed halfway through the next day. You could have hot showers at night or during the day though. Other than that, the staff was excellent and accomendating. We had food during the conference that was catered, which was delicious. The rooms are nice and spacious, and there are tons of restaurants a few blocks away. The San Diego Bay is a short walk from the hotel as well. I definitely recommend it even with the shower problems because it could have just been bad timing.

Reviews.Title: “I was almost denied my last day of prepaid stay.”
Reviews.Author: practicaltraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Curious. I had a prepaid booking for 4 night via Quikbooks. When i arrived, I was told I had booked only 3 nights and that the 4th night was unavailable. I was upset and had to argue with the clerk about the legitimacy of my claim. I had to gather my paperwork to show proof that I had prepaid 4 nights. They argued that they were not responsible for the error in booking as I had booked through a 3rd party! I had a printed confirmation stating that the 3rd party had verified reservation with Westin. There were no guarantees or reassurances made until the following day, when the clerk got an ok with a supervisor. This was upsetting. I like the location and the rooms, but may look for another place to stay in the future. This was my second time this year in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent shopping and location”
Reviews.Author: tognir
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for a mixture of business and leisure. My boyfriend was working for two days at a conference in the hotel which was the main reason for our visit. Our room was nice, recently renovated so everything was new and shiny. We found all the staff in the hotel to be extremely helpful and the bar staff recommended good places to eat nearby. We had the buffet breakfast one day, not cheap but very tasty. The hotel is in a good location, near a massive shopping centre (Macy's, Abercrombie, Levi's e.t.c) and close to the Gaslamp quarter with lots of bars and restaurants. Our only issue was lots of homeless people around but we saw this all over the USA. The hotel charges for internet usage, but so did the others we visited in LA and San Francisco. We visited the zoo and balbao park, a short taxi ride away, well worth seeing if you have the time. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: alwaysonvacation_35
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in I was greeted by every staff member with a smile. I arrived hours before check-in but was allowed to pre-register and offered the opportunity to have my luggage stored until I actually checked-in. This allowed me time to relax and explore hotel and the surrounding area. I was very surprised but happy when Raquel offered to call me on my cell phone once my room was ready. When she left the voicemail it was pleasant and I appreciated her saying that I didn't have to rush back and that I could stop pass the front desk at my convenience to pick up the room key. The concierge was very knowledgeable; she took the time to help me map out my points of interests. Once I returned she asked about my sightseeing and if I was able to find everything. Later that evening I asked her where I could get a pizza for dinner and she made one phone call to a local pizza restaurant, asked for the manager and advised that guests from the Westin would be coming. She then handed me the restaurants card, which was an offer for free pizza. Even though, it was just a pizza place the service provided by the concierge made me feel like I was going to a fine dining establishment. My stay at the Westin was after a very exhausting trip overseas and it offered me the opportunity to relax. From the great service provided to me by the staff to the small gestures of kindness and the heavenly bed all were more than appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Trysh66
Reviews.Content: The location was great, the staff good and the room clean. This is all the good I can say about the Westin Gaslamp. I am a solo traveler for business, the fact that there was a 20% surcharge on room service is absurd, and a movie tax on top of the $14.99 for a movie, and they charge $9.95 a DAY for internet!! This is an absurd amount considering I get internet at home for $9.95 a month!! I will never stay at this Westin again, there is no justification for the 20% surcharge on room service, and the internet prices ? Common Westin, 99% of hotels these days offer free internet! And at the price I was paying for my room? Just not worth it. I can stay at a Super 8 where there's a free breakfast, free internet, and free parking for 1/2 the cost of the Westin, and its just as clean and the service is great! And talk about my bill? They double charged me 14.95 in the same day for internet. Thought it was only 9.95 Westin. The fact that you can so clearly take advantage of your guests is beyond me. Check your bills people, they will charge for stuff and won't credit you when you question it. Saying it's hotel policy. Crap, just crap.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable and clean and the location is great

Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Westin Gaslamp in San Diego for a meeting. The hotel staff were helpful.... especially the concierge. I donâ€™t usually post comments, but in this case I felt the Westin earned some recognition.
